articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Chinese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Chinese President
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, on Tuesday sent messages of sympathy to Hu Jintao, president of China, and Wen Jiabao, premier of the State Council of China, in connection with the recent landslide that hit Zhuqu County, Gansu Province and consecutive days of torrential rain which struck different parts of China, claiming heavy casualties and material losses. 
					 They in the messages extended deep sympathy and consolation to the president, the premier, the government and people of China and the victims and their bereaved families and sincerely hoped that the people in the afflicted areas would eradicate the aftermath of the natural disasters and bring their living to normal as early as possible under the leadership of the Communist Party of China and the Chinese government.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Russian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Russian President
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of sympathy to Dmitri Anatolievich Medvedev, president of Russia, as regards the forest fires that hit various regions of the country, claiming great human and material losses.
					 Extending deep sympathy and consolation to the president and, through him, to the victims and the bereaved families, Kim in the message expressed belief that the Russian government and people would prevent the expansion of the fires and heal their aftermath in short period.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Friendly Visiting Group
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Friendly Visiting Group
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday with the China-DPRK friendly visiting group headed by Xin Qi, vice-president of the China Association for International Friendly Contact, on a visit to the DPRK to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the Chinese People's Volunteers' entry into the Korean front.
					 On the occasion Xin Qi said that the traditional China-DPRK friendship provided by Chairman Mao Zedong and Premier Zhou Enlai and other leaders of the elder generation of China and President
						 Kim Il Sung is growing stronger under the deep care of General Secretary Hu Jintao and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people closely rallied around Kim Jong Il would achieve great success in building a thriving nation, true to the Songun politics.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK-Chinese Public Security Ministries
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK-Chinese Public Security Ministries
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Ministry of People's Security and the Chinese public security were held here on Wednesday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were members of the delegation of the Ministry of People's Security led by Vice-Minister Choe Jung Hwa and from the Chinese side members of the Chinese public security delegation headed by Liu Jing, executive vice-minister of Public Security, and a staff member of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					  At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the exchange and cooperation and a series of matters of common concern.

articles.title: Aid Materials from Chinese Public Security Ministry
articles.content:
Aid Materials from Chinese Public Security Ministry
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Public Security of China donated aid materials to the DPRK Ministry of People's Security.
					 A presentation ceremony was held here on Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were officials of the Ministry of People's Security including its Vice-Minister Choe Jung Hwa and members of the Chinese public security delegation headed by Liu Jing, executive vice-minister of Public Security, and a staff member of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: Notice to President of S. Korean Red Cross
articles.content:
Notice to President of S. Korean Red Cross
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society sent a notice to the president of the south Korean Red Cross on Wednesday.
					 The notice said that Rev. Han Sang Ryol, pro-reunification champion of south Korea staying in Pyongyang, is expected to go back to the area of the south side on August 15 via Panmunjom as requested by him.
					
					 In this connection the chairman of the C.C., Red Cross Society of the DPRK requested his south Korean counterpart to notify the relevant organ of this so that it may take a necessary measure for the safe return of Rev. Han from a humanitarian viewpoint.

articles.title: Rev. Han Sang Ryol Visits Various Places
articles.content:
Rev. Han Sang Ryol Visits Various Places
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Rev. Han Sang Ryol of south Korea visited the International Friendship Exhibition House.
					 Han looked round gifts presented to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il by heads of parties and state and prominent personages of many countries in the world and south Koreans and overseas compatriots. 
					
					 He also visited the West Sea Barrage. 
					
					 He watched a video showing how the barrage was constructed before commanding its bird's-eye view from the observation platform.
					
					 He watched grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang."

articles.title: Floral Basket from Chinese
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Chinese
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket by the family of Zhang Weihua, a Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, on Wednesday on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of liberation of Korea.

articles.title: New Postage Stamps Issued
articles.content:
New Postage Stamps Issued
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- New stamps (a souvenir sheet and a sheetlet) have been issued by the State Stamp Bureau of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea with the approach of the 65th anniversary of national liberation.
					 Seen in the upper parts of the stamps is an inscription "Commemoration of 65th anniversary of national liberation -- Juche 34 (1945)-Juche 99 (2010)".
					
					 The souvenir sheet contains a Korean painting "February holiday greeted with national liberation approaching" portraying President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk among anti-Japanese fighters.
					
					 Printed in the sheetlet are art works showing revolutionary activities of the President in the periods of the anti-Japanese armed struggle and building of a democratic state.

articles.title: Pyongyang Housing Construction Makes Headway
articles.content:
Pyongyang Housing Construction Makes Headway
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The construction of apartment buildings for 100,000 families is progressing apace in Pyongyang.
					 The housing construction is undertaken mainly by servicepersons, the Pyongyang City Construction Management Bureau and construction companies.
					
					The Workers' Party of Korea called for the 100,000-unit construction as part of the effort for opening the gate to a thriving nation in 2012 marking the 100th birth anniversary of President
						 Kim Il Sung.
					
					 True to the call of the WPK, soldier-builders have made a breakthrough in the construction, topping their daily assignments at more than 200 percent.
					
					 Builders of the Junggu Public Building Construction Company and the Tonggu Housing Construction Company are now engaged in interior and exterior projects after finishing frame assembling.
					
					 Those from the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League have carried out 60 percent of frame assembling in Rangnang-Ryokpho area.
					
					 Those from the Ministry of Coal Industry, the Ministry of Commerce and the Ministry of Light Industry have also made a progress in their projects.

articles.title: Japan's Arms Build-up Blasted
articles.content:
Japan's Arms Build-up Blasted
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries are going into militarist hysteria in a desperate bid to step up their moves for arms build-up and nuclear weaponization, prompted by their sinister intention to conquer Asia.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a signed commentary.
					
					 There are serious issues not to be overlooked in the report on a "new security policy" presented by a research group belonging to the Japanese government, an ill-famed think tank representing the militarist forces as an advisory body of the Japanese prime minister, the commentary notes, citing specific facts to prove the fact. 
					
					 What matters is that the above-said policy will be a theoretical basis of the "defence program guidelines" to be revised by the Japanese government within this year, the commentary observes, and goes on: The new "defence program guidelines" is a document of military scenario for aggression stipulating issues which Japan will regard as guidelines for military affairs in about ten years to come. 
					
					 They called for reexamining a provision of the three non-nuclear principles banning the introduction of nuclear weapons, underscoring the need for the U.S. to offer "a nuclear umbrella" to Japan in the above-said report. This glaringly shows what extent the Japanese "serpent" has reached in its hysteria for nuclear weaponization. 
					
					 The Japanese militarists are putting spurs to beefing up their aggressor forces in a bid to realize their wild ambition to become "a leader of Asia" by force of arms.
					
					 The DPRK is the primary target of Japan's attack for overseas aggression. 
					
					 The Japanese militarist forces are keen to realize their ambition to stage a comeback to Korea and translate their old dream of "the Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" into reality at any cost by use of such war lever as the Japan-U.S. military alliance. 
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that the peace and stability in this region will be disturbed and Japan's blood-stained history of aggression will repeat itself in case the sphere of military operation of the Japanese militarist forces is extended to the vast area of the Asia-Pacific including the Korean Peninsula, going beyond the boundary of the Japanese territory.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Properly Settle Issue of Korean Schools
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Properly Settle Issue of Korean Schools
Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Those concerned of the Korean school in Osaka and representatives of Japanese civic organizations on Aug. 5 visited Japan's Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology to hand a paper of over 39,000 signatures demanding its government include the Korean schools in Japan in the tuition-waiver program for senior high schools.
					 They held that the tuition aid program should be applied to the Korean schools without discrimination to meet the need of the international community and ensure future of Japan.
					
					 They urged the government to make sure that everybody is given an opportunity of learning on an equal basis.
					
					 Ha Su Gwang, chairman of the Chiba Prefectural Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and other officials of Chongryon and those concerned of the Korean schools in Chiba and Hiroshima and representatives of Japanese civic bodies also visited the ministry to lodge a protest with it on the same day.
					
					Conveying to the ministry the paper containing signatures of over 33,300 Korean residents and Japanese citizens in Chiba, Hiroshima, Kochi, Tokushima and Ehime prefectures, they declared that it represents the demand for lifting a discriminating measure against the Korean schools.
					
					 Recalling that the Koreans in Japan are also paying taxes just as the Japanese citizens do, they blasted the Japanese government for excluding the Korean schools from the tuition aid program.
					
					 That day the vice-chairman of the Hyogo Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon and the director of the Hyogo Prefectural People's Council for the Japan-DPRK Friendship met with the vice secretary- general of the Democratic Party of Japan.
					
					Reminding him that more than 50,000 Korean residents and Japanese citizens in Hyogo Prefecture participated in the signature campaign, they reiterated their will to continue struggling for getting the discriminatory policy towards the Korean schools retracted.

articles.title: Int'l Seminar Held in Tokyo
articles.content:
Int'l Seminar Held in Tokyo
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- An international seminar "We question Japan about the centenary of "Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty" was held in Tokyo on August 6 and 7 on the occasion of the centenary of the fabrication of the brigandish treaty by the Japanese imperialists.
					 The participants in the seminar denounced the Japanese imperialists for putting Korea under their military occupation early in the 20th century and imposing all sorts of misfortune and sufferings upon the Korean people through a colonial rule. They deplored that the leftover of colonial idea still remains and persistently reigns in social realms of Japan.
					
					 Akira Nakatsuka, honorary professor at Nara National Women's University, referred in her speech to the grave situation prevailing in Japan these days where open remarks beautifying Hirobumi Ito are heard, adding that the aggressive, brigandish and colonial assertion of Ito that Japan's security could not be guaranteed if other country occupies Korea is still reflected in its Korea policy. 
					
					 She lambasted the Japanese authorities for working hard to perpetuate the division of the Korean Peninsula, not its reunification.
					
					 Other speakers also lashed out at the Japanese authorities for refusing to redress their crimes though a century has passed since the fabrication of the above-said treaty, far from taking the stand of owning the responsibility for its colonial rule over Korea in the past and reflecting on it.
					
					 This is clearly evidenced by the authorities' discrimination and abuses of rights of Koreans in Japan, the victims of the colonial rule, and their children, they held.
					
					 They urged the Japanese authorities to roll back the unreasonable policy of discrimination against the Korean schools and stop violating the rights of Koreans in Japan and other actions.

articles.title: Struggle for Korea's Reunification Supported
articles.content:
Struggle for Korea's Reunification Supported
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The Norway-DPRK Friendship Association released a bulletin on Aug. 2 on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of the publication of General Secretary
					 Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					 The bulletin noted that in the work published on August 4, 1997, Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles of national reunification--independence, peaceful reunification and the great national unity--, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo advanced by President Kim Il Sung as the three charters for national reunification.
					
					 Thanks to his energetic activities and bold decision the year 2000 saw the inter-Korean summit, the first of its kind in the Korean nation's history of division, and the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration the keynote of which is the idea of "By our nation itself" and the start of the June 15 era of reunification in which the north and the south of Korea are advancing towards the reconciliation, unity and reunification, it said.
					
					 The bulletin stressed that the Norwegian friends of the DPRK are convinced that the Korean people will surely win in the struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country by their own efforts without foreign interference, true to Kim Il Sung's instructions for national reunification under the distinguished leadership of Kim Jong Il, and extend invariable support and solidarity to their struggle.

articles.title: US and S. Korean Forces' War Moves under Fire
articles.content:
US and S. Korean Forces' War Moves under Fire
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK issued a statement on Aug. 5 in denunciation of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet group's reckless moves for a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					 The statement expressed full support and solidarity with the army and people of the DPRK in their struggle for defending the sovereignty of the country as the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet group are staging ceaseless criminal and provocative war maneuvers targeted against the DPRK.
					
					 It termed the "Cheonan" warship case a strategic farce cooked up by the U.S. to justify the madcap moves to invade the DPRK.
					
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association also made public a similar joint statement on Aug. 4.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- One day in September Juche 55 (1966), General Secretary
					 Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to Chosan County, Jagang Province, early in the morning.
					 Looking around a cornfield, his clothes wet with dew, he took earless cornstalks in his hands.
					
					 An official told him that some cornstalks had no ear because corn seeds had been sown so thickly.
					
					 Denying the official's explanation, he said it was because regulation fertilizers had not been applied to the field.
					
					 After measuring the spaces between cornstalks, he said that farming should be done in such a way as planting all crops close together and taught the officials corn farming methods tested by himself, including corn seed processing, period of sowing, suitable varieties of fertilizers and amount of fertilizers to be applied according to growing stages.
					
					 Since then, the methods have been accepted by all rural communities in mountainous areas.

articles.title: Cuadros coreanos expresan condolencias a dirigentes chinos
articles.content:
Cuadros coreanos expresan condolencias a dirigentes chinos
Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, y el premier del Consejo de Ministros, Choe Yong Rim, enviaron el dia 10 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de la Republica Popular China, Hu Jintao, y al primer ministro del Consejo de Estado, Wen Jiabao, en relacion con que hubo grandes perdidas humanas y materiales a causa del derrumbe de montanas surgido en el distrito de  Zhuqu de la provincia de Gansu y la lluvia torrencial que persiste varios dias en varias zonas de China.
					Los remitentes expresan la profunda compasion y condolencias a los destinatarios, el gobierno, el pueblo de China, las victimas y sus familiares, deseando de todo corazon que los habitantes de zonas damnificadas eliminen cuanto antes las consecuencias de desastres naturales y recuperen su vida estable bajo la direccion del Partido Comunista de China y el gobierno chino.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de condolencias a Medvedev
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de condolencias a Medvedev
Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 11 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de la Federacion Rusa, Dmitri Anatolievich Medvedev, en relacion con que causa muchas perdidas humanas y materiales el incendio forestal que azota varias zonas rusas.
					En la misiva el remitente expresa el profundo pesame y condolencias al destinatario y por su conducto, a las victimas y sus familiares y manifiesta la fe de que el gobierno y el pueblo rusos impediran la expansion del fuego y resarciran en los dias cercanos las consecuencias de danos.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones de seguridad publica de Corea y China
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones de seguridad publica de Corea y China
Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 11 en esta capital las conversaciones entre la delegacion del Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo de Corea y la del Ministerio de Seguridad Publica de China.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion del MINSEP encabezada por el viceministro Choe Jung Hwa y por la china los miembros de la delegacion del MINSEP presidida por el viceministro ejecutivo Liu Jing y un miembro de la embajada china acreditada en Corea.
					
					Ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el fortalecimiento de intercambio y colaboracion y otros problemas de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Presidente del CC de la ACR envia aviso a su homologo surcoreano
articles.content:
Presidente del CC de la ACR envia aviso a su homologo surcoreano
Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ATCC) -- El presidente del Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea envio el dia 11 un aviso a su homologo surcoreano.
					La nota senala que segun la peticion del pastor surcoreano pro-reunificacion Han Sang Ryol, quien se encuentra en Pyongyang, el regresara el dia 15 a la parte surcoreana por via de Phanmunjom.
					
					La Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la RPDC desea que la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea lo notifique a los organos correspondientes para que se tomen en vista del humanitarismo las medidas necesarias para el regreso sin problemas del pastor Han, subraya el aviso.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena el armamento nuclear de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena el armamento nuclear de Japon
Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ATCC) -- En un comentario individual publicado el dia 11, el periodico Rodong Sinmun condeno la locura militarista de los reaccionarios japoneses que aumentan sus fuerzas armadas y tratan de tener las armas nucleares para realizar su siniestra ambicion de conquistar a Asia.
					 Un colectivo de investigacion perteneciente al gobierno japones, conocido ampliamente como organo consultivo del premier y entidad de cerebros que representa a las fuerzas militaristas, publico un informe relativo a la "nueva politica de seguridad" que contiene serios problemas que no se pueden pasar por alto.
					
					 Asi senala el comentarista y continua:
					
					 El problema esta en que ese informe servira de base teorica del "gran programa de defensa" que va a enmendar el gobierno japones dentro de este ano.
					
					 El nuevo "programa" deviene el plan militar agresivo que estipula oficialmente los problemas que Japon debe tomar como su guia en el sector militar durante casi 10 anos futuros.
					
					  En aquel informe dicha entidad planteo la revision del articulo de la prohibicion de introduccion de armas nucleares en los "tres principios para la desnuclearizacion" hablando de la necesidad del ofrecimiento del "paraguas nuclear" de EE.UU. a Japon.
					
					  Esto demuestra claramente cuan grave es la locura de la "vibora" militarista por armarse con artefactos nucleares.
					
					  Los militaristas japoneses dan acicate al aumento de las fuerzas armadas agresoras para realizar con la fuerza su descarada ambicion de ser "caudillo de Asia".
					
					  La RPDC es el primer blanco de ataque en la eventual agresion de Japon a ultramar.
					
					  Las fuerzas militaristas de Japon tratan de realizar a toda costa su ambicion de agredir otra vez a Corea y su largo sueno de la "esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia Oriental" usando la alianza militar con EE.UU. como palanca de guerra.
					
					  Resulta obvio que si el teatro de operacion de las fuerzas militaristas de Japon se amplia a la vasta region de Asia y el Pacifico, incluida la Peninsula Coreana, traspasando la frontera de ese pais, seran perturbadas la paz y la estabilidad de esta region y se repetira la historia de agresion ensangrentada de los imperialistas japoneses.
